Package controller

Class LoginController

java.lang.Object
controller.LoginController
public class LoginController extends Object
Author:
ikojic000 The LoginController class is responsible for handling user login functionality. It interacts with the UserDAO class to retrieve user credentials and update user information.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    LoginController()
    Constructs a new LoginController object and initializes the UserDAO instance.

  • Constructor Details

    • LoginController

      public LoginController()
      Constructs a new LoginController object and initializes the UserDAO instance.

  • Method Details

    • checkCredentials

      public Object checkCredentials(User user)
      Verifies if the user's credentials are valid and returns the corresponding user if they are. If the password is incorrect, returns a string with an error message.
      Parameters:
      user - the User object containing the username and password to be verified
      Returns:
      the corresponding User object if the credentials are valid, or a string with an error message otherwise

    • getUser

      public User getUser(User user)
      Returns the User object corresponding to the given User object.
      Parameters:
      user - the User object to retrieve from the database
      Returns:
      the corresponding User object if found, or null otherwise

    • getLoggedInUser

      public User getLoggedInUser()
      Returns the currently logged in User object.
      Returns:
      the currently logged in User object

    • setLoggedInUser

      public void setLoggedInUser(User user)
      Sets the currently logged in User object.
      Parameters:
      user - the User object to set as the currently logged in user

    • updateUser

      public void updateUser()
      Updates the information of the currently logged in user.

    • updateUserPhoto

      public void updateUserPhoto(File photo)
      Updates the photo of the currently logged in user.
      Parameters:
      photo - the File object representing the new user photo
